Prepositions_key1: Preposition: is a word which joins a noun or pronoun to a sentence or another word to show relationship. (Pre=before; position=place)
Prepositions_key3: There is no water in the well. (relationship with ‘there is no water’ and ‘well’)
Prepositions_key4: He will leave by tomorrow’s train. (relationship of ‘leave’ [verb] with ‘train’ [noun])
Prepositions_key5: We are proud of you. (relationship of ‘proud’ [adjective] with ‘you’ [pronoun])
Prepositions_key11: She went _ America when she was older.
Prepositions_key13: MeToo movement is related _ sexual harrasment.
Prepositions_key14: Many students go higher studies other cities.
Prepositions_key15: Like many youngsters, he is not comfortable _ English.
Prepositions_key17: Make sentences using the following prepositions.
Prepositions_key18: on, at, in, before, after, for, since, under, with, behind

Prepositions_key22: This land is situated among the desert and the grassland.

Prepositions_key24: Arun cut his hand by a knife.
Prepositions_key25: The student did not come to class since many days.
Prepositions_key26: This is a comfortable house to live.
